alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Kenedy; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 4:06PM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Very cold wind chills expected. The ice will result in very slippery conditions on sidewalks, roads and bridges, including during the morning commute on Friday. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze are expected. Expect wind chills to range from 20 to 30 degrees. * WHERE...Portions of Deep South Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 12 AM to 12 PM Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, 9 PM this evening to 12 PM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are expected This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
